# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Certainly! Here is an implementation of a "pig latinify" function in Julia using multithreading:

```julia
using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify_word(word::String)::String
    vowels = Set(['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'])
    if word[1] in vowels
        return word * "yay"
    else
        for i in 1:length(word)
            if word[i] in vowels
                return word[i:end] * word[1:i-1] * "ay"
            end
        end
    end
    return word
end

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})::Vector{String}
    pig_latin_words = copy(words)
    @sync for i in 1:length(words)
        @spawn pig_latin_words[i] = pig_latinify_word(words[i])
    end
    return pig_latin_words
end

# Usage example
words = ["hello", "world", "julia", "language"]
pig_latin_words = pig_latinify(words)
println(pig_latin_words)
```

The `pig_latinify` function iterates over a vector of strings and converts each string to Pig Latin on a separate thread using the `@spawn` macro. Threads synchronize with the main thread using the `@sync` macro to make sure that all words have been processed before returning the transformed list.

using Base.Threads

function pig_latinify_word(word::String)::String
    if isempty(word)
        return word
    end
    
    # Handle word punctuation
    prefix, word_body, suffix = match(r"^(\W*)(\w+)(\W*)$", word).captures
    
    lower_word_body = lowercase(word_body)
    vowels = Set(['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u'])
    idx = findfirst(c -> c in vowels, lower_word_body)
    
    if idx === nothing  # No vowels in the word
        pig_word_body = word_body
    elseif idx == 1
        pig_word_body = lower_word_body * "yay"
    else
        pig_word_body = lower_word_body[idx:end] * lower_word_body[1:idx - 1] * "ay"
    end
    
    # Preserve the case of the first letter if it was uppercase
    if isuppercase(word_body[1])
        pig_word_body = uppercasefirst(pig_word_body)
    end
    
    return prefix * pig_word_body * suffix
end

function pig_latinify(words::Vector{<:AbstractString})::Vector{String}
    pig_latin_words = Vector{String}(undef, length(words))
    @sync for i in 1:length(words)
        @spawn pig_latin_words[i] = pig_latinify_word(words[i])
    end
    return pig_latin_words
end
